Title.En: Digital Transformation of Energy Sector Greenhouse Gas Management

Description.En:
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services with a team of 52,800+ best-in-class experts across 55 countries. Operating in 11 major industries, EPAM is at the forefront of delivering cutting-edge solutions to world leaders in the energy sector.

In our commitment to sustainability & decarbonisation advisory, we help companies develop AI/ML-enabled data platforms to control climate change. The challenge we offer students to contribute to is one of the most sought by our clients, given the significant contribution of the energy sector to greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions impacting global warming.

To propose effective emission management solutions, we'll tackle challenges such as various regulations, different data sources and formats, inaccurate estimations and reporting, and monitoring & detection difficulties.  

Potential solutions include remote sensing (e.g. satellite emission monitoring), emission cloud data accessibility, and AI-based oil field intelligence. Let's co-create the future of data-driven energy enterprises together!

Read more about EPAM projects in the Energy & Resources industry: https://www.epam.com/industries/energy-and-resources

Title.En: Create and present ideas and prototypes

NoteLiteral.En: Create and effectively present innovative ideas and developed prototypes tailored to the requirements of unique audience.

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: Self-sufficiently pinpoint a unique and impactful research direction, utilizing existing knowledge and acquired competencies.
Innovatively tackle complex real-world issues using the core tenets of challenge-based learning methodology.
Utilise effective teamwork and leadership principles while collaborating within diverse, interdisciplinary teams.

Title.En: Digital Transformation of Energy Sector Greenhouse Gas Management
Digital Transformation of Energy Sector Greenhouse Gas Management

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The challenge will be solved in the module "**[Development of Challenge-Based Innovation](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=INNOM010&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)**" (6 ECTS, online meetings – 32 hours, individual and group work – 128 hours). The module follows the challenge-based learning method: engagement, inspiration, investigation, and action.

The module will be delivered **online from October 3 to December 19, 2024**. The scheduled meetings with the teamchers and the peer learners will be held **once a week on Thursdays**: October 3, 10, 17, 24, 31; November 7, 14, 21, 28; December 5, 12, 19. The meetings **start at 15.30 EET and end at 17.00/18.00 EET** (depending on the day). Please note that attendance is mandatory and highly appreciated by your team members. 

The learners are supported by the KTU teamchers (faculty) and the partner company EPAM. The learner teams are presented with the challenge during the kick-off meeting, they are invited to do an interim presentation on the progress of their project in the middle of the module and the final presentation of the challenge solution at the last meeting of the module. The final grade is passed/failed.
Co-creating data-driven sustainable solutions sought by energy sector leaders

Join us in the challenge to reduce the impact of energy companies on global warming through innovative data solutions. We're seeking disruptive ideas to make emission accounting in energy companies more transparent, precise, and timely. This problem is top of mind for industry leaders today, given its urgency and importance in finding cutting-edge solutions for greenhouse gas emissions management. Let's work together to make a difference in the sustainability of energy operations and mitigating climate change!
